newsitem.title: CHINA: China railway to launch new express.
newsitem.headline: China railway to launch new express.

text.p: China is to speed up its sluggish railway network by introducing a fast new train from eastern Shanghai to Nanjing, the Xinhua news agency said on Saturday.
China's fastest train would hit the tracks next month, whisking passengers between the two commercial centres at up to 183 km per hour (114 mph) the agency said.
The double-decker, air-conditioned train would shorten the time needed for the 300 km (186 miles) trip to two and a half hours, it said.
The express was just part of China's national efforts to raise speeds on its often sedate rail network, it said.

The maximum speed of trains on lines from Beijing to Shanghai, southern Guangzhou city and northeastern Harbin would be raised to 160 km per hour (100 mph) from 140 km per hour (86 mph) by 2000, Xinhua said.
Chinese trains usually run at far below their maximum speeds, prompting regular calls for more non-stop expresses and an expanded and improved track network.
China has said it will spend 330 billion yuan ($39.8 billion) expanding its railways over the next five years. ($1 = 8.3 yuan)
